Text:
I voted YES on the Justice in Policing Act in honor of George Floyd. Police brutality, particularly against Black Americans, has persisted far too long.

This bill will ban chokeholds, end qualified immunity and fund community-led safety initiatives.

Police must be accountable. https://t.co/C7UP1hO2Bu

H.R. 1 will:

üó≥Expand automatic & same day voter registration, vote by mail & early voting. Stop partisan gerrymandering. Protect elections from foreign interference.
üí∞Reign in dark money & special interests.
‚öñÔ∏èEnforce ethics rules for officials.

We must protect our democracy.

Now in the second year of this pandemic, we‚Äôre all tired and anxious.

But there‚Äôs reason for hope.
¬†
A third vaccine is approved. Johnson & Johnson's is easier to produce and distribute.

There will be enough supply to vaccinate every American adult by late May.
¬†
Hang in there. https://t.co/FfjEcov1Mh

Russia has undermined international security and violated human rights for far too long:
¬†
Invading and annexing Crimea.
Interfering in elections.
Targeting dissidents and activists.
¬†
These sanctions send an important message: No more.
¬†
The U.S. will stand up to Putin‚Äôs Russia. https://t.co/A5Gwkb54pz

Late last night, I voted YES on the COVID relief package.‚Ä®
Relief checks. Funding for vaccines and reopening schools. Food, unemployment and rental assistance.‚Ä®
These measures are urgently necessary. And incredibly popular.‚Ä®
The Senate must act. There‚Äôs no time to waste.

Congress will be voting late tonight, possibly into the early morning, on the $1.9 trillion COVID relief bill.

But across America, millions stay up late every night wondering how they‚Äôre going to make ends meet.

We have to stay until we get this done. And we will.

The Biden Administration should ensure that repercussions for the brutal murder of Khashoggi go beyond those who carried it out, to the one who ordered it.
 
The Crown Prince has blood on his hands. The blood of an American resident and journalist.
 
We must have accountability. https://t.co/99poiTPX30

Senators arguing against raising the minimum wage make $174,000 a year.
¬†
The minimum wage is now $7.25 an hour, or $15,000 a year.
¬†
That‚Äôs not a living wage. Raising it to $15 will lift millions out of poverty.
¬†
Americans don‚Äôt care how it gets done, just that we do it. ASAP.

The House just voted to protect 1.5 million acres of wilderness, including my bill to preserve 191,000 acres in Southern California's Rim of the Valley.

The magic of LA is in the open space that connects us.

These pristine public lands must be protected for generations to come. https://t.co/au8evZx3Bd

For two years, we pushed for the truth to be made public:
¬†
The highest levels of the Saudi government, including Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, are responsible for the brutal murder of Jamal Khashoggi.
¬†
There must be accountability, and we will continue to press for it. https://t.co/gAdf9apsPU

One easy way to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 is to provide free, high-quality masks to all Americans.

I‚Äôve been urging this since early last year, and I‚Äôm pleased the new Administration is taking the lead.

The faster we act, the quicker we defeat the virus. Mask up. https://t.co/PBnWsD5IbB

Millions of LGBTQ Americans face employment, housing, and healthcare discrimination just because of who they love, how they identify, and where they live.‚Ä®
This must stop.

We just passed the¬†#EqualityAct¬†to attack these injustices. Now the Senate must act. https://t.co/X0U5lUvxkR

Here‚Äôs what's in the COVID relief package:
¬†
Direct checks to families
Unemployment assistance
Money to reopen schools
Vaccine funding
Food aid
$15 minimum wage
Child care funding
Rental assistance
Eviction moratorium
¬†
All popular. All necessary. All urgent. Let‚Äôs get it done.

Last May as we approached 100,000 COVID deaths, it seemed unfathomable.

Now we have crossed an even more grim milestone: 500,000 lives lost.

Precious few have escaped this virus' grief and devastation.

We are together in our mourning. And we must be together in our rebuilding. https://t.co/6snquU4367

Democracy is under assault, and autocracy is on the march. As¬†@POTUS¬†said, ‚Äúdemocracy doesn‚Äôt happen by accident.‚Äù
¬†
It takes each of us, working each day, to defend, strengthen, and renew it ‚Äì both here at home, and around the world.
¬†
And it is always worth the struggle. https://t.co/w0ZwdvcgH0

Mr. President, if you'll indulge me a moment as a proud representative...
¬†
The Perseverance Rover was built and designed at @NASAJPL in La Ca√±ada, CA.

And once it's safe, we'd love to invite you and @VP Harris for a tour of the incredible facility that just put a rover on Mars. https://t.co/T7LcaZEzc2

I just (virtually) joined hundreds of local students,
¬†
Watching for a tiny rover, constructed in our community, to land on the Red Planet.

At a time when good news has been hard to find, we got word:

Perseverance made it safely to Mars.

And I couldn‚Äôt be prouder of @nasajpl. https://t.co/5L8oidVX3M

.@POTUS should cancel $50,000 in student loan debt for all.

For 10 years, my student loan debt payments were more than my rent.

Student debt affects everybody, and particularly people of color, making it hard to buy a home or start a family.

Our economy should work for all. https://t.co/MQOHQgARWk

Some say that the remedy of impeachment is flawed, an unworkable mistake of the founders.
¬†
That‚Äôs nonsense.
¬†
There is nothing wrong with the Constitution, its draftsmanship, or the oath.
¬†
Only with those who need uphold it.
¬†
The fault lies not in our laws, but in ourselves.

The House Managers upheld their oaths with skill and passion.

Our eternal thanks to @RepRaskin, @RepDianaDeGette, @davidcicilline, @JoaquinCastrotx, @RepSwalwell, @RepTedLieu, @StaceyPlaskett, @RepJoeNeguse and @RepDean.
¬†
The case they made will stand the test of history. https://t.co/Tk7l8QJ14s

Watching McConnell‚Äôs harsh indictment of Donald Trump for his lies and incitement, for his lack of remorse and dereliction of duty,

I couldn‚Äôt help but think of how much McConnell indicts himself for an even greater dereliction of duty:

Failing to hold Trump accountable. https://t.co/sCLhmJOpsx

GOP Senators showed us their party is still in Trump‚Äôs thrall, more devoted to him than to America‚Äôs ideals.

Yet, I remain hopeful.

America was built by those who believed in something never seen before ‚Äî a government of the people.

It will be rebuilt with the same faith. https://t.co/H87VsvySLg

What is it going to take for Republicans to hold Trump accountable?
 
If they fail to do their duty, they‚Äôll have to answer to history.
 
Senators must demonstrate courage. And if they don't?
 
We will have the specter of Donald Trump hanging over us for years to come. https://t.co/mqIQiVAwQy

Trump‚Äôs defense:

Phony jurisdiction argument.

Claim Trump has a First Amendment right to violate his oath.

It‚Äôs not an insurrection if it fails.

He can‚Äôt incite if people came ready to be incited.

Even defending his election lies.

...It‚Äôs hard to defend the indefensible.

Trump‚Äôs lawyers can‚Äôt contest the facts, so they‚Äôre making a false claim about the First Amendment.

Let's be clear: Trump has no First Amendment right to violate his oath of office.

No more than a fire chief has the right to tell arsonists to burn down the station.

.@RepRaskin posed four questions for Trump's lawyers to answer:

‚ÄîWhy did Trump not tell his supporters to stop?

‚ÄîWhy did he do nothing to stop the attack?

‚ÄîWhy did he do nothing to help?

‚ÄîWhy did he not condemn the attack on January 6th?

What will be their answer?

As people lay dead and injured, our Capitol desecrated, Trump tweeted at 6:01 pm:
¬†
‚ÄúThese are the things and events that happen when a sacred landslide election victory is so unceremoniously & viciously stripped away...‚Äù
¬†
Trump was knowing, willful, and remorseless.

The release of Saudi women's rights activist Loujain al-Hathloul is an important, but long overdue, development.
¬†
Loujain‚Äôs torture and three-year imprisonment was an outrage, and she should be freed from restrictions on her speech and travel by Saudi authorities. https://t.co/WoT0ImgE10

In his choice of date, time, and place, Trump knew exactly what he was doing.

Trump directed his mob at the Capitol, Vice President Pence, and the Joint Session of Congress.

We can only hope that Senators have their eyes open. But we know that the nation is watching. https://t.co/AphHvTjhoe

One cannot watch the powerful evidence assembled, and not acknowledge a simple truth:

Trump incited a mob to attack the peaceful transfer of power.

We lived through it. And now all Americans are seeing the chilling details.

Senators dare not look away or fail to do their duty.

There are worse things than losing an election.
 
Not upholding our duty to the Constitution. Failing to show courage, and regretting it.

We know Trump will continue to lie and cheat. He can put this country through hell again.

Senators have the power to stop that.

Use it. https://t.co/ZtvedacX4d

The defense case was weak and convoluted, to say the least.

Yet 44 Republican Senators still voted to avoid a trial, rather than confront the facts.

But there is no hiding from our Constitutional duty.

If we condone, excuse or shield Trump‚Äôs misconduct, we invite it again.

The House Managers‚Äô opening statement was flawless and irrefutable.
¬†
A seamless weaving of powerful video, Constitutional arguments, and history.
¬†
@RepRaskin‚Äôs emotional appeal moved anyone not made of stone.
¬†
Hard to imagine a more perfect presentation.

Trump spent months telling lies about the election and trying to overturn the results.¬†

When all else failed, he called his supporters to DC and incited them to attack the Capitol. They did.

Trump is responsible for the most serious attack on our democracy in American history.

It‚Äôs just common sense:

Presidents must be accountable for their offenses, whether they occur on the first day of their term or the last.

Our Founders agreed. The history of the impeachment power agrees. There‚Äôs no ‚ÄúJanuary exemption.‚Äù

Trump must be convicted. https://t.co/1yc22H8O2p

But enough about Britain.
 
In 1876, the U.S. Secretary of War William Belknap was impeached for accepting a bribe.

He was impeached *while* he was in office. He faced trial *after* he left office. The Senate voted 37-29 that former officials could be tried.

Sound familiar?

The Founders accepted this view of impeachment, and adopted it when drafting our Constitution.
 
They also recognized that impeachment had to have ‚Äúteeth,‚Äù so no one could escape accountability by leaving office.

Disqualification from future office was always essential! https://t.co/cTvDzFmU1J

Parliament impeached the former Lord Chancellor in 1725 for acts of bribery during his term.

And in 1787, while America's Founders met to draft our Constitution, Warren Hastings of Britain was impeached for abuses he committed while Governor-General of Bengal.

Our Founders didn‚Äôt invent impeachment from scratch. Oh no.

According to Hamilton, they looked to Britain which provided ‚Äúthe model from which the idea of this institution has been borrowed.‚Äù
 
In the 18th Century, British Parliament impeached two men ‚Äì both *former* officials. https://t.co/ZAFHT8t6yX

You're going to hear a lot of bad faith arguments about impeachment.

Trump‚Äôs team will argue you can‚Äôt convict former officials or presidents.

But history shows otherwise! And the Founders disagreed, too.

Let's turn to 18th Century Britain. (Stay with me, folks)

üö®üö®üö®THREAD: https://t.co/Kn7RwpQunO

If you threaten members with violence, spread dangerous conspiracies or heckle school shooting survivors, you should be expelled from your committees.

That's a principle both parties can stand by.

But @GOPLeader places little value on principle, when weighed against ambition. https://t.co/w0HdHGoD0l

Trump lost. Refused to accept the result. Spread lies. And then incited a violent mob to attack the Capitol. 

If this is not impeachable, nothing is.

If he is not disqualified from future office and runs again, he will put the country through hell. Again.

He must be convicted. https://t.co/8ogWm3hzgi

Donald Trump politicized and abused intelligence while he was in office.

Donald Trump cannot be trusted with America‚Äôs secrets. Not then, and certainly not now.

Americans can sleep better at night knowing he will not receive classified briefings as an ex-president. https://t.co/RCvpzV8dlg

Kevin McCarthy on QAnon: "I don't even know what it is."

Donald Trump: "I don't know who Proud Boys are."
¬†
When your party is so beholden to violent fringe groups that your only defense is to play dumb, you are no longer a political party.

You are nothing more than a cult. https://t.co/TNusz0VYT0

Voting a member off a committee is not something to take lightly.
¬†‚Ä®But calling for the execution of elected officials and spouting violent and anti-Semitic conspiracies crosses every line.‚Ä®
She hasn‚Äôt apologized. She's only fanned the flames.

If @GOPLeader¬†won‚Äôt act, we will. https://t.co/TwtqIvenZW

Sending a free mask to every American would equip millions with the tools to keep safe, and send an important message:

Masks work.

I've been pushing for this since last summer, and recently urged @POTUS to increase distribution of high-quality masks.

Let's get it done. https://t.co/gixRG9TDnh

No matter what Trump claims, there‚Äôs no First Amendment right to incite an insurrection.

Just because Trump vocalized his corrupt intent doesn't mean it's protected "free speech."

There's no First Amendment defense to violating your Constitutional duty.

He should be convicted. https://t.co/EiKPgH8YwO

As new COVID-19 variants spread, evidence shows that higher quality masks provide much better protection.

That's why @RepRoKhanna, @SenSanders, @SenBrianSchatz and I are urging @POTUS to increase the distribution and supply of higher filtration quality masks.

Mask up, America. https://t.co/rFnrFod04t

Donald Trump must never receive another intelligence briefing.

He has repeatedly proven he cannot be trusted. He incited an insurrection, and has done more than enough damage to our country.¬†

We know Trump will abuse any intel for his own gain. He must not be given the chance. https://t.co/eM1lV3wLtI

It‚Äôs not enough to protect our democracy. We must make it stronger.
¬†
HR 1 will:‚Ä®
üó≥Expand the right to vote
üîíProtect our elections
üí∏End dark money in politics‚Ä®‚öñÔ∏èRoot out corruption and hold elected officials accountable‚Ä®
Our democracy belongs to the people. Let's act.

When corporations and the wealthy want tax cuts, or when there's a vacancy on the Supreme Court, Senate Republicans move at the speed of light.
¬†
But when American families are in dire need of help, they ask, what‚Äôs the rush?
¬†
COVID relief is needed. Urgently. It‚Äôs time to act.

Maher Bitar is exceedingly smart, principled, insightful and strategic.

These attacks on his religion and ethnicity are beyond the pale.

NSC is fortunate to have people of his talent, just like we were.

Our nation is more secure because of patriotic public servants like him. https://t.co/hczXHUgFXp

Here's the risk if Trump isn‚Äôt convicted:

A future president will try to overturn the election at the end of their term.

If they succeed, they‚Äôre president for life.

If they fail, and can‚Äôt be held to account, we can expect it to happen again.

There must be consequences. https://t.co/hDDi5LREcy

Some Republicans in Congress seem confused about what ‚Äúunity‚Äù means.

They seem to think that if you don‚Äôt give them what they want, you‚Äôre not for unity.
‚Ä®That‚Äôs not unity, that‚Äôs my way or the highway.

We're in a crisis and Americans need help. ¬†

Let‚Äôs unite around that.

The Constitution and precedent are clear:

Impeachment after a president leaves office is valid.

And when a president incited an insurrection to thwart the transfer of power at the end of his term,

It‚Äôs required.

The Senate must uphold its oath to defend our democracy. https://t.co/GWXu85x2xf

President Biden has his priorities in order:

Speaking with our NATO allies before returning Putin‚Äôs call.

Calling out Putin on the hack, election meddling, bounties, and poisoning, all while pushing a new START treaty.

This is how a President asserts U.S. interests and values. https://t.co/z1ibN1Pyp8

Patriotism knows no gender nor orientation.
¬†
Ending the transgender military ban is another vital step in restoring America‚Äôs promise of equality.
¬†
Anyone with the courage and sense of duty to serve this country should be allowed to do so ‚Äî with our thanks and gratitude. https://t.co/2zY1qfPyx8

Russians are taking to the streets today in the freezing cold to peacefully demand freedom, human rights for all their citizens, an end to corruption, and the immediate release of Alexei @Navalny.
¬†
I stand with them. The United States, and the world, must stand with them, too. https://t.co/OtKebHgMBm

For four years, our values were belittled, the rule of law was battered, and our democracy was broken down.

By a deeply unethical man who had no business in the Oval Office.

Our democracy survived, but only just. What we do to rebuild, will determine its future. 

And our own. https://t.co/tEvR8XW1VD

Through his lies and provocations, Trump incited a mob to attack the peaceful transfer of power.
¬†
As House members, we did our job and impeached him.¬†

It will soon be time for Senators to do theirs.

To protect the country, Trump must be disqualified from any further office.

The brutal murder of Jamal Khashoggi was an assault on human rights.

But for a year the Trump Admin refused to make public an unclassified report on Saudi Arabia's culpability.

I have asked Director Haines to declassify this report. There must be accountability and justice. https://t.co/yr5fukB7vh

One year ago, the U.S. recorded its first COVID-19 case.

More than 410,000 deaths later, we finally have a national strategy.

The path forward won‚Äôt be easy. And the winter is going to be dark. But we will prioritize science, truth and transparency.‚Ä®
We will beat this virus. https://t.co/ssQ1zkA4Iv

With this order, we once again put our faith in science and in our ability to adapt and overcome great difficulties.

We rejoin the world in protecting our planet for generations to come.

What we do to fight climate change will determine our legacy‚Äî

Or if we will even have one. https://t.co/QCIbjePRYg

For four years, intelligence professionals were battered and belittled by a President afraid of the truth.

Avril Haines will ensure that politics is kept out of their work, just as it should be.

Congratulations, @ODNIgov Director Haines, and look forward to our work together.

America faces some of the gravest challenges in our history. We must act now.
¬†
Day 1:
‚úîÔ∏èMask mandate
‚úîÔ∏èEnding the Muslim Ban
‚úîÔ∏èRejoining the Paris Climate Accords
‚úîÔ∏èPausing student loan payments
‚úîÔ∏èExtending eviction moratorium
¬†
There¬†is no time to waste.

‚ÄúSomehow we‚Äôve weathered and witnessed,

A nation that isn't broken, but simply unfinished.‚Äù

‚ÄúFor there is always light,¬†

If only we're brave enough to see it,¬†

If only we're brave enough to be it.‚Äù

‚Äî@TheAmandaGorman
https://t.co/3fki2MELUY

For four years, our values and our democracy were under attack.

With difficulty, we withstood the assault.

But for the first time in a long time I‚Äôm breathing a sigh of relief.

Today marks the beginning of a national renewal.

The hopes of a nation are with you, Mr. President.

Steve Bannon is getting a pardon from Trump after defrauding Trump‚Äôs own supporters into paying for a wall that Trump promised Mexico would pay for. 

And if that all sounds crazy, that‚Äôs because it is.

Thank God we have only 12 more hours of this den of thieves. https://t.co/8i7bjog9Ep

For two years, I‚Äôve fought to ensure accountability for Jamal Khashoggi‚Äôs brutal torture and murder.

We even mandated a public accounting in law. And for two years, the Trump Administration blocked us, and kept it classified.

This welcome change can‚Äôt come soon enough. https://t.co/YRJoXEwhLi

400,000 lives lost to COVID-19.
¬†
The death toll is staggering. For some, incomprehensible.‚Ä®
Unless you're one of the families in mourning.‚Ä®
Or have one of the 400,000 empty seats at your dinner table.
¬†
My heart goes out to everyone in pain. We will get through this, together.

‚ÄúPower at its best is love implementing the demands of justice, and justice at its best is power correcting everything that stands against love.‚Äù - Dr. King

On this #MLKDay, let us commit to taking on Dr. King‚Äôs unfinished work, using our power to create a more just society.

The insurrection was an act of domestic terrorism, fueled by white supremacism and incited by Trump.

It was also a massive intelligence and security failure.

What intel was gathered before Jan 6? Was it shared? Why wasn‚Äôt it acted upon? Were members involved?

We must find out. https://t.co/gjYbYnNoJr

Donald Trump should never receive another intelligence briefing ‚Äî not now, and not in the future.

He cannot be trusted and has done enough damage to our country already.

Trump remains a security threat, and will continue to be a security threat long after he leaves office. https://t.co/bCe7tm7eEb

This plan is a no brainer:

‚Ä¢ New $2k relief checks
‚Ä¢ Expedited vaccine rollout
‚Ä¢ Eviction moratorium
‚Ä¢ Increased minimum wage to $15/hour‚Ä®
The road to recovery is long. But recovery is not the only goal.

We must create a better, more equitable and just society.

Let's go. https://t.co/ghEMFQVLEn

Yesterday, we impeached Donald Trump for the second time.

I hope that when we look back on the day we did so, it will be remembered as the day America got off the road to dictatorship and returned to the path of our Founders envisioned for us:

A democratic republic. https://t.co/VGiDcW2VQr

For the fourth time in American history, and the second time in Donald Trump‚Äôs dangerous and destructive tenure, a president has been impeached.
¬†
We will defend our democracy against all threats, foreign and domestic.‚Ä®
Donald Trump must be removed, never to hold office again.

Let's talk about unity.

It‚Äôs not an empty talking point. It has to mean something.

We must be united against attacks on our democracy. 

United against those who violate their oaths.

United against a president who incites a violent mob to overturn an election.

That's unity.

Trump incited an insurrection against a peaceful transfer of power.

And yet our democracy endures.

Throughout history, at every pivotal moment when evil threatened to overtake good, patriotic Americans stepped forward to say ‚Äúenough.‚Äù

This is one of those moments.

Enough. https://t.co/bArIDc5JCM

Trump whipped up a mob into a frenzy. He told them to go to the Capitol and ‚Äúfight like hell.‚Äù

And they did. With tragic results. And it could have been much, much worse.

Upholding our oath means recognizing that every second Trump is president, the nation is at risk.

Impeach. https://t.co/Kckd9XcE26

Handling a Senate trial is a grave responsibility.

But I know @RepRaskin, @RepDianaDeGette, @davidcicilline @JoaquinCastrotx, @RepSwalwell, @RepTedLieu, @StaceyPlaskett, @RepJoeNeguse and @RepDean will make the case.
¬†
This president must be held accountable and removed.

Incitement of insurrection is an impeachable offense.

No one contests that. 

Either we uphold our oath to protect the constitution, or we do not.

Either we safeguard our democracy, or we do not.

It‚Äôs really that simple. Trump must be impeached. Now.

I know where I stand.

The 25th Amendment should be invoked, but if the Vice President refuses to do his duty, Congress will move with urgency to do ours.

Trump incited a violent insurrection, and for that he must be impeached.

Every day this man is in office, he is a grave danger to the nation. https://t.co/Ugq5Y7dWKF

We can fortify the defenses of the Capitol.¬†

We can reinforce doors and put up fences.

But we cannot guard our democracy against those who walk the halls of the Capitol, have taken an oath to uphold our Constitution, but refuse to do so.

The American people can expect the House will do its duty. And we will move swiftly.

But the Senate must undertake its Constitutional obligation, as well.

If McConnell stonewalls, he will bear responsibility for whatever dangerous acts this president commits in the days ahead. https://t.co/zcIgYo2JcK

Donald Trump spent years demagoguing, lying, spreading hate, and propagating conspiracies on Twitter. And worse, inciting violence.

Social media companies have allowed this vile content to fester for too long, and need to do much more.

But banning him is a good start. https://t.co/bBvGtxeMMl

The House should act to begin impeachment proceedings.

It's the only instrument wholly within our power to remove a president who has so manifestly and repeatedly violated the Constitution.

Every effort must be made to protect the country from further harm. https://t.co/ym4YpiXkDd

Donald Trump lit the fuse which exploded at the Capitol.

Every day that he remains in office, he is a danger to the Republic.

He should leave office immediately, through resignation, the 25th Amendment or impeachment.

My reflections from Wednesday:

https://t.co/Sv60pCW830 https://t.co/HvVMPpDlNK

Yesterday, a seditious mob broke into the Capitol.

Spurred on by the President and inflamed by falsehoods told by his allies on Capitol Hill.

Look at the damage they have done.

To the Capitol, and to the country. 

It must end. https://t.co/l5Nd9wL9qH

Hi folks, my staff and I are safe. Thanks to the Capitol Police.
¬†
A violent mob won‚Äôt stop us from upholding our constitutional duty to certify the election.

This is a moment when everyone must decide whether our democracy is worth protecting.

I believe it is.

Congress was once the place of giants.

Have we become so small? Does our oath to uphold the Constitution, taken just days ago, mean so very little?

I think not.

It has never been our place to overturn an election.

As long as we hope to remain a democracy, it never will be. https://t.co/G3y7OQVrwI

We are witnessing nothing less than an attack on the bedrock of our democratic process ‚Äî our free and fair elections.
 
So I wanted to take some time to walk you through exactly what is going on today in Washington D.C. and how we got here:
https://t.co/qcoFHR9pD9

He has betrayed our national security, and he will do so again.

He has compromised our elections, and he will do so again.

You will not change him. You cannot constrain him. 

Truth matters little to him. What's right matters even less. And decency not at all.

Enough. https://t.co/oSr0N72Bit

.@SpeakerPelosi led us through the last four dark years with great intellect, sharp tactics, and, of course, her huge heart.

As we confront COVID-19, climate change, healthcare and inequality, our Caucus trusts in her leadership.

Congrats, Madam Speaker! The work continues.

Trump‚Äôs contempt for democracy is laid bare. Once again. On tape.

Pressuring an election official to ‚Äúfind‚Äù the votes so he can win is potentially criminal,

And another flagrant abuse of power by a corrupt man who would be a despot, if we allowed him.

We will not. https://t.co/YH7VtLJn3x

Last year, we proved Donald Trump guilty of abusing the power of his office.

But Republican Senators refused to convict, claiming on principle, voters should decide.

Now, those same Senators wish to overturn the election results.

They have no principle, only fear and ambition.

2020 challenged us all in so many ways, revealing stresses on our democracy, disparities in our justice system, and terrible inequities in public health.

But America is resilient. And in 2021, we'll build back better. We must.¬†

Here's to a better year ahead.

For years, Republicans were obedient to Trump‚Äôs every whim.

They stood by his failed COVID response. His lies. His impeachment. His corrupt pardons. His efforts to overturn the election.

But $2,000 checks to help Americans? That‚Äôs where they draw the line?

Pass the bill.
